item.title: About
item.description: I am a third year Ph.D. student studying statistics at North Carolina State University. My thesis advisor is Dr. Brian Reich. My research interests include Bayesian inference Quantile regression Machine learning Currently, I am working on simultaneous quantile regression using Bayesian non-parametric approach. An in-depth introduction to my thesis topic can be seen here.

item.title: Demo
item.description: Bayesian Simultaneous Quantile Regression This is a visual demonstration of my current project. The objective is to simultaneously estimate nonlinear noncrossing quantile curves using Bayesian nonparametric approach. Bayesian Quantile Regression with Python Jupyter-notebook A simple implementation of Bayesian quantile regression using neural network and asymmetric Laplace likelihood. Posterior sampling is carried out by Hamilton Monte Carlo with Dual Averaging.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Online Unsupervised Wildfire Detection Using Satellite Imagery: Technical Report Submitted to 2nd IEEE Workshop on Machine Learning for Big Data Analytics in Remote Sensing Transportability from randomized trials to routine care: On initial HIV treatment with efavirenz and suicidal thoughts or behaviors Submitted to American Journal of Epidemiology (under revision) Review of Simultaneous Quantile Regression Methods: Technical Report Ph.d. written preliminary exam (passed) Multivariate Process Monitoring using Canonical Variate Analysis: Poster @ 2019 SAS Intern Expo, Slides
